body.p:
Chesnut Grove
Shelby Co. Ky
January Febuary 25th 1861
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky,

We the undersigned citizens of Shelby County and State of Kentucky do most respectfully petition your excellency to remit a fine recently imposed upon one George Bossstock an adopted citizen of this Commonwealth for the amount of Twenty Five. ($25.) Dollars, on an indictment for a breach of the Peace which we believe to be unjust and oppressive to the said George Bossstock whose conduct has been characterized by industry, honesty, and good deportment. Hoping you will give this matter your Earliest attention we subscribe ourselves, -- Yours most Respectfully

Wm C Price
Wm A Thompson
Loyd S Bodkin
Wm C McCannon
William H Bell
W D Bowland C S C
W. H. Mason
A. P. Hickman
I understand that all the Jurors in this case except one have signed this petition & he was not seen. The Petitioners are among the cleaverst citizens of the county --

Jas Lowry
J. T. Kinkead
Andrew Price
Richard Price
B. F. Gloyde
C S White
T. J. White
James S White
H. Price C. S. C.
W. T Caplinger
S E Kinkead
Geo. W. Caplinger
P H Mason
W. S. Guthrie
James M Welman
Jas W Crawford J. P. S. C.
Joseph T Hamblen, S. S. C
Poll. H. Price

Shelby
Remitted
B. M
Isd Feby 27. 61
Geo Bosstock
